Index.title: Google Maps Scraper: Free & Easy to Use - Free Maps Scraper
Index.description: Free Maps Scraper: an efficient, easy-to-use tool for extracting business leads from Google Maps. Quickly gather phone numbers, emails, and more. Free to try!

Download.title: Download the Free Maps Scraper Chrome Extension
Download.description: Step into the world of effortless data extraction with the Free Maps Scraper, a Chrome extension that streamlines your lead generation process. Download our free and easy-to-use tool today and start harvesting valuable data from Google Maps.

Hero.text1: This scraping tool is perfect for businesses, providing a fast and efficient way to extract Google Maps data.
Hero.text2: With its easy-to-use interface, you can easily extract phone numbers, email addresses, social media accounts, local data, and much more, all of which can be exported to a csv file for convenient management.
Hero.text3: We have 5000+ happy customers and have extracted

PrimaryFeatures.h2: With Easy Google Maps Data Scraper for Accurate Business Leads
PrimaryFeatures.t1: Enhance your lead generation strategy with our Google Maps Scraper with a single click.
PrimaryFeatures.t2: With our efficient scraping tool, tap into a wealth of local business data to power up your sales and marketing efforts.
PrimaryFeatures.t3: Get Leads with Our Free Google Maps Scraper
PrimaryFeatures.t4: Your simple choice for navigating Google Maps for business info. Find everything you need, from phone numbers to social media details, and download it all in CSV file.
PrimaryFeatures.t5: Easy to Extract Business Locations and Contacts
PrimaryFeatures.t6: Make your marketing smoother with our easy-to-use freemapsscraper. Scraping location info and contact details, and boost your lead gathering to the next level.
PrimaryFeatures.t7: Boots Your Sales with Accurate Local Business Data
PrimaryFeatures.t8: freemapsscraper boosts your sales with fresh, correct leads. Use the latest local business info to reach out more effectively and turn potential customers into actual buyers.

HowToWorkSection.h2: How to Use Free Maps Scraper Chrome Extension
HowToWorkSection.t11: Start by pinpointing the exact business locations you're interested in with our search feature. Type in relevant keywords, and our Free Maps Scraper will comb through Google Maps to find every potential lead.
HowToWorkSection.t21: Navigate to the area of interest on Google Maps, then activate the freemapsscraper Chrome extension with a single click. It's that simple—no complex setup or configuration needed. Just a few seconds and you're on your way to compiling a robust database of leads.
HowToWorkSection.t31: Once the scraping is complete, you can export the data into a CSV or XLS file for easy analysis and integration. With support for an unlimited number of exports, freemapsscraper ensures that you have continuous access to the latest data. The export includes essential information like phone numbers, email addresses, exact locations, and social media profiles—everything you need to connect with your targeted audience effectively.

DataFieldSection.h2: What Data Can You Scrape Using Free Maps Scraper
DataFieldSection.d1: The following table lists all supported data fields.
DataFieldSection.Name: Name of the place on Google Maps, this is usually the canonicalized business name.
DataFieldSection.Phone: The place's phone number in its local format.
DataFieldSection.Email address: The place's email scraped from the internet.
DataFieldSection.Social Medias: The social media profile URLs found from the internet (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Youtube, Yelp, Twitter, and so on).
DataFieldSection.Website: The authoritative website for this place, such as a business' homepage.
DataFieldSection.Domain: The web domain associated with the place.
DataFieldSection.Fulladdress: The complete, readable address of the place.
DataFieldSection.Street: The specific street where the place is located.
DataFieldSection.Municipality: The governing municipality where the place is situated.
DataFieldSection.Categories: The categories associated with the place on Google My Business.
DataFieldSection.Claimed: Indicates if the Google My Business profile has been claimed, allowing verification and editing of business information on Google.
DataFieldSection.Price: The price range of the place, rated from $ (lowest) to $$$$ (highest).
DataFieldSection.Plus code: Plus codes serve as alternative addressing in areas lacking traditional addresses, such as unnumbered buildings or unnamed streets.
DataFieldSection.Review Count: The cumulative count of reviews for the place.
DataFieldSection.Photos: User-uploaded photos related to the place.
DataFieldSection.Average Rating: The overall rating of the place, ranging from 1.0 to 5.0, determined by user reviews.
DataFieldSection.Review URL: The dedicated URL where customers can leave reviews for the place.
DataFieldSection.Google Maps URL: The official Google Maps link for the place.
DataFieldSection.Google Knowledge URL: The URL for the Google Knowledge Panel associated with the place, which provides information when searching for entities in the Google Knowledge Graph.
DataFieldSection.Latitude: The geographic latitude of the place, expressed in decimal degrees.
DataFieldSection.Longitude: The geographic longitude of the place, expressed in decimal degrees.
DataFieldSection.Opening hours: The specified hours during which the place is open to the public.
DataFieldSection.Featured image: A highlighted photo representing the place or business.
DataFieldSection.Cid: A unique identifier assigned by Google to a specific business entity.
DataFieldSection.Place Id: A unique textual identifier that distinguishes a specific place.
DataFieldSection.Kgmid: An identifier used specifically for the Google Knowledge Graph API.

PricingSection.d1: It doesn't matter what size your business is, our software will work well for you.

Faqs.desc1: Have a different question about Map Lead Scraper and can’t find the answer you’re looking for? Reach out to our support team by
Faqs.desc3: and we’ll get back to you as soon as we can.
Faqs.q0: How can the tool obtain email addresses if they are not visible on Google Maps?
Faqs.a0: Our Google Maps scraper extends its search beyond Maps by visiting each business's official website found through Google Maps. It searches for contact pages or directly listed email addresses, thereby providing you with email details not typically found on Google Maps itself.
Faqs.q1: Is the Google Maps extractor compatible with Mac or is it Windows exclusive?
Faqs.a1: Our browser-based Google Maps extractor is versatile and runs on any operating system that supports Chrome browser, including but not limited to Windows, macOS, and Linux. Simply install it as an extension to your Chrome browser.
Faqs.q2: Why am I not seeing all results when I search across large regions?
Faqs.a2: To optimize search efficiency and accuracy, it's recommended to focus on smaller areas, particularly for extensive regions. Instead of searching for 'California restaurants', narrow it down to 'Los Angeles restaurants' or specific ZIP codes to get more precise results.
Faqs.q3: Can this tool extract data from maps other than Google Maps?
Faqs.a3: While our tool is currently specialized for Google Maps data extraction, we acknowledge the diverse needs of our users. Should you require scraping services for other map sources, we are equipped to develop customized solutions upon request.
Faqs.q4: What distinguishes the free version from the paid version of the tool?
Faqs.a4: The free version of our tool provides a glimpse into the efficient scraping capabilities, allowing up to 15 listings per search. On the other hand, the paid version offers unlimited records, advanced functionalities, and supports automatic batch extraction, providing a comprehensive and streamlined experience.
Faqs.q5: How can I cancel my subscription?
Faqs.a5: To cancel your subscription, simply go to the settings menu within the extractor app and select 'Manage Subscription'. If you prefer, you can also reach out to our customer support via email with a request to cancel your subscription, and we'll assist you promptly.

DownloadPage.h1: Download Free Maps Scraper Chrome Extension
DownloadPage.h1sub: Free Maps Scraper is a chrome browser extension that helps users to scrape and extract information from Google Maps. Please follow the instructions below to install and get started.
DownloadPage.desc: Map Lead Scraper is a chrome browser extension that helps users to scrape and extract information from Google Maps. Please follow the instructions below to install and get started.
DownloadPage.Step 1: Step 1: Download and Unpack Chrome Extension
DownloadPage.desc1: Download: after downloading, unzip the extension.
DownloadPage.desc2: Unpack: extract the files to a safe folder, not Downloads, to avoid accidental deletion.
DownloadPage.Step 2: Step 2: Open Chrome and Enable Developer Mode
DownloadPage.desc4: or click the menu in the top-right, select "Extensions", then "Manage Extensions."
DownloadPage.desc5: Enable "Developer mode" at the top right of the Extensions page.
DownloadPage.Step 3: Step 3: Install Google Maps Scraper Extension
DownloadPage.desc6: Click "Load unpacked" and navigate to the extension file location. Select the directory and click "Open".
DownloadPage.desc7: Finish the installation. The extension should now be in your installed extensions list.
DownloadPage.Note1: 1. The new extension may not appear in the extensions bar by default. To pin it, click the Extensions icon (puzzle piece) in the top-right corner. Find your extension in the dropdown list and click the pin icon next to it.
DownloadPage.Note2: 2. The extension will now be visible in your Chrome toolbar.
DownloadPage.desc8: Your experience is important to us. If you have any issues or suggestions, our support team is eager to assist.
DownloadPage.desc9: Contact us through our support page, and we'll help you make the most out of Free Maps Scraper
